 Talk How to Install and Use Ad Aware for Spyware Removal   
 If your computer has slowed down quite a bit, crashes a lot more than it used to, and seems to put out a constant stream of pop-ups and ads, chances are good that your computer is infected with "adware." Adware is a term for files and programs that get put on your computer without your knowledge or consent, in order to display ads to you. Adware not only slows down your system, it can sometimes create a security risk. Some Adware programs send personal information to third parties, about what you do with your computer so they can send you "relevant" advertising. Ad-Aware is a free product which finds and removes this Adware. This article will show you everything you need to know to successfully install and use Ad-Aware. 
 Note:  The red spider shown in the screenshots indicate which button or item to click.

 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/58\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-25.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-25.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/58\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-25.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-25.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 4 
 Click on each of the red X marks to change them to green checks.  Please note that no matter how many times you click on the second and third items from the top, they will remain gray X marks. Only click on red X marks, and click them all until they are replaced by green checks. When the screen looks like what is shown above, click "Proceed." On the screen that appears, you will see a section like this:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-26.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-26.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-26.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-26.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Select "Use custom scanning options" and click "Next. " (Please note that it doesn't matter whether there is a green check or a red X next to "Search for negligible risk entries.") The scan will begin, and the next screen that appears will feature lots of file names and other gibberish that flashes by very quickly. You can safely ignore all of this. As the scan progresses, you will probably see something like this:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/70\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-27.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-27.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/70\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-27.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-27.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 6 
 Unless your computer is clean, Ad-Aware will find all kinds of bugbears and trolls lurking on the hard drive.  As the scanner finds each problem, the count of "critical objects" will go up. The picture above shows 41 problems found, but you may have many more.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-28.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-28.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/85\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-28.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-28.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 7 
 Depending on the speed of your computer and the number of files and programs on your hard drive, the scan can take quite a while (30-60 minutes, sometimes more).  When the scan is complete, you will see something like this on the screen:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fd\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-29.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-29.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/fd\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-29.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-29.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 8 
 This lets you know how many problems were found.  Click "Next." On the screen that appears, you will see a section like this:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5f\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-30.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-30.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5f\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-30.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-30.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 9 
 This is the nasty stuff that we want to get rid of.  To do that, right-click (click with the right mouse button) on any of the listings. It doesn't matter which listing you right-click on. After you right-click, a menu will pop up. It looks like this:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9f\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-31.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-31.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9f\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-31.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-31.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 10 
 Click on "Select all objects. " This places a checkmark next to all of the spyware files found by Ad-Aware. Your screen should now look like this:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-32.jpg\/v4-459px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-32.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/da\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-32.jpg\/v4-759px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-32.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":340.57692307692,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":562.69230769231} 
 11 
 Click "Next. " The box shown below will appear:
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/ba\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-33.jpg\/v4-460px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-33.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/ba\/Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-33.jpg\/v4-760px-Install-and-Use-Ad-Aware-for-Spyware-Removal-Step-33.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 12 
 Click "OK" to get rid of the spyware once and for all.  A box will appear that says "Quarantining selection," followed by a box which says "Deleting selection." Both of these boxes will disappear on their own. You don't need to click anything else. After the "Quarantining" and "Deleting" boxes disappear, you will see the full Ad-Aware screen again. You can now close the program, you are finished!

 Tips Edit 
 When too much spyware is loaded on your computer, it eats up your system resources and you notice a drastic slowdown. You may also notice tons of pop-ups that seem impossible to stop. In addition, your web browser may take you to the wrong sites, and after a while, it might quit working altogether. In fact, if you use Internet Explorer and you don't have any spyware removal tools, chances are your computer is infected by hundreds of problem-causing objects.

 The purpose of most spyware programs is to show you ads and/or send information about you to advertisers. Most often, the spyware will inform the advertiser about all of the websites you are visiting. Some spyware programs use this information to show you targeted ads. Spyware can be installed on your computer just by surfing the web. Websites place spyware on your system because advertisers pay them to do so. Spyware is almost everywhere (except on wikiHow).
